text:
A number of free programs
are available on Windows
that allow users to adjust
and modify their voice output sound.
In this tutorial, we will use Clownfish,
a popular free software that changes
your voice across any application.

First, navigate to
clownfish-translator.com.
Then click "DOWNLOAD."
Select the version that is compatible
with your PC and OS version.
Once downloaded,

launch the installer
and follow the prompts

to complete installing
Clownfish onto your PC.
Now that it's installed,

search for Clownfish in the
start menu to launch it.

The application will
appear in the system tray
rather than a window by default.
Right-click the icon to access the menu.
The top option, "Set Voice Changer,"

will allow you to customize the
effects applied to your mic.

With the custom effect
applied in Clownfish,

open up Discord's settings and
navigate to "Voice & Video."
Confirm your input device is correct

and using the mic you
have Clownfish altering.
Below, select test mic
to confirm your voice is coming through.

[distorted] I'm using the
voice-changer effect currently.
If it is, Clownfish is working properly

and can now be used on
a Discord voice chat.
